lessonInfo: Quranic letters are written by connecting to adjacent letters, similar to cursive handwriting. The shape of each letter changes depending on its position within a word.
Note: The letters ا د ذ ر ز و do not connect to the following letter. These letters have identical forms in the medial and final positions.

Thin and Thick Letters
Quranic letters are divided into two groups: thin (light) and thick (heavy). Of these letters, 18 are pronounced with a thin sound and 10 with a thick sound.
Thin-sounding letters: ى ه و ن م ل ك ف ش س ز ذ د ج ث ت ب ا

Thick-sounding letters:
The letters ق غ ظ ط ض ص خ are always pronounced with a thick, heavy sound.
The letters ع and ح are pronounced with a near-thick sound.
The letter ر is sometimes thick and sometimes thin, depending on its context.
